title: üé≠ Your Vision
subtitle: Let's explore what drives you forward
context: Your vision is the foundation of everything. The clearer and more compelling it is, the more likely you are to achieve it. Take your time here - this shapes everything else.

fields.label: What's your dream?
fields.context: Paint a vivid picture of your ideal future. Be specific about what success looks, feels, and sounds like. The more detailed, the better.
fields.placeholder: Example: I'm leading a team of 10 engineers at a top tech company, building products used by millions. I wake up excited about work, feel valued for my expertise, and have the financial freedom to travel with my family twice a year.

fields.label: Why this, why now?
fields.context: Your 'why' is your fuel when things get tough. Dig deep - what emotions, values, or life experiences drive this goal?
fields.placeholder: Example: I want to prove to myself I can achieve something ambitious after feeling stuck in my current role. I want my kids to see that big dreams are possible, and I crave the intellectual challenge of solving complex problems.

fields.label: How important is this?
fields.context: Be honest about your current emotional investment. This helps us calibrate the right approach for you.

options.label: Curious
options.description: I'm exploring this idea, seeing if it resonates

options.label: Interested
options.description: This sounds appealing, I'd like to learn more

options.label: Committed
options.description: I'm ready to put in serious effort to make this happen

options.label: Obsessed
options.description: This is my #1 priority, I think about it constantly

fields.label: Timeline?
fields.context: Different goals need different approaches. Short sprints require intensity, while long journeys need sustainability.

options.label: Sprint (1-3 months)
options.description: Quick wins, immediate results, high intensity

options.label: Marathon (6-12 months)
options.description: Steady progress, building momentum, balanced effort

options.label: Mountain (1+ years)
options.description: Long-term vision, patience required, multiple phases

title: üí™ Your Style
subtitle: How do you work best?
context: Understanding your natural work patterns helps us design a plan that actually works with your life, not against it.

fields.label: Time commitment?
fields.context: Be realistic about your current life situation. It's better to consistently do less than to plan for more and give up.

options.label: Micro Bursts
options.description: 15-30 minutes at a time, perfect for busy schedules

options.label: Focused Blocks
options.description: 1-2 hour dedicated sessions, deep work mode

options.label: Flexible Flow
options.description: Variable time blocks, adapting to daily energy and schedule

fields.label: Work traits? (Select all that apply)
fields.context: These patterns shape when and how you'll be most productive. Choose what naturally describes you.

options.label: Morning Person
options.description: Peak energy 6-10am

options.label: Night Owl
options.description: Peak energy 8pm-12am

options.label: Routine Lover
options.description: Thrive with consistent schedules

options.label: Spontaneous
options.description: Work best with variety and flexibility

options.label: Social Worker
options.description: More productive around others

options.label: Solo Player
options.description: Focus best when alone

options.label: Perfectionist
options.description: High standards, attention to detail

options.label: Pragmatic
options.description: Focus on 'good enough' and progress

fields.label: Intensity level?
fields.context: Your natural intensity level affects how we structure your journey. Work with your energy, not against it.

options.label: Zen
options.description: Calm, steady, sustainable pace

options.label: Balanced
options.description: Mix of intensity and rest periods

options.label: High Octane
options.description: Fast-paced, energetic, ambitious goals

options.label: Beast Mode
options.description: All-in, maximum effort, competitive drive

fields.label: Learning style?
fields.context: How do you best acquire new skills and knowledge? This shapes the resources and approaches we recommend.

options.label: Hands-on
options.description: Learn by doing, building, experimenting

options.label: Research
options.description: Study first, then apply - love courses and books

options.label: Community
options.description: Learn through discussion, mentorship, groups

options.label: Structured
options.description: Clear curriculum, step-by-step programs

title: üèóÔ∏è Your Foundation
subtitle: What's your starting point?
context: Understanding where you're starting from helps us build the right bridge to where you want to go. Be honest about your current situation.

fields.label: Readiness level?
fields.context: Where are you emotionally and practically right now? This determines the pace and approach we'll recommend.

options.label: Exploring
options.description: Still figuring things out, want to learn more

options.label: Ready
options.description: Decided to pursue this, ready to start planning

options.label: Unstoppable
options.description: Fully committed, ready to take massive action now

fields.label: Why can you succeed?
fields.context: This isn't bragging - it's identifying your real advantages. What unique combination of skills, experiences, or traits do you have?
fields.placeholder: Example: I have 5 years of customer-facing experience so I understand user needs deeply. I'm naturally curious and great at breaking down complex problems. I've successfully learned new skills before (taught myself guitar, completed a marathon). My network includes several engineers who could mentor me.

fields.label: Past lessons? (Optional)
fields.context: Previous attempts (successful or not) are valuable data. What patterns have you noticed about how you work best or what trips you up?
fields.placeholder: Example: I've tried coding bootcamps before but struggled with the pace. I learned I need more time to practice concepts before moving on. I'm better with project-based learning than abstract theory. I tend to give up when I don't see progress quickly, so I need to celebrate small wins.

title: üß† Knowledge & Experience
subtitle: What do you know and what have you done?
context: Honest self-assessment here is crucial. Overestimating leads to frustration, underestimating misses opportunities. Rate yourself compared to others pursuing similar goals.

fields.label: Industry trends
fields.context: Do you understand what's happening in your target field? New technologies, market shifts, key players, hot topics?

fields.label: Competitive landscape
fields.context: Who are the major companies, products, or players in your target space? What makes them successful?

fields.label: Business models
fields.context: How do companies in your target field actually make money? What are different approaches to generating revenue?

fields.label: Real impact?
fields.context: Focus on results you personally drove, not team achievements. Use numbers where possible. What did you build, ship, or accomplish that created measurable value?
fields.placeholder: Example: Led redesign of checkout flow that increased conversion by 15% over 6 months. Managed budget of $500K and team of 3 contractors. Built internal tool used by 50+ customer service reps daily. Personally closed $2M in sales through relationship-building with 3 key enterprise clients.

fields.label: Decision level?
fields.context: What's the highest level of responsibility you've had? This impacts the types of opportunities you're ready for.

options.label: Execution
options.description: Follow detailed instructions, implement others' plans

options.label: Tactical
options.description: Make decisions about how to achieve given goals

options.label: Strategic
options.description: Set goals and direction for projects or teams

options.label: Ownership
options.description: Full responsibility for outcomes, P&L, vision

title: üíé Hidden Assets
subtitle: What unique value do you bring?
context: These 'soft' assets are often more valuable than credentials. They're what make you memorable and create opportunities.

fields.label: Unique value? (Select all that apply)
fields.context: What makes you different from others pursuing similar goals? Your unique combination is your competitive advantage.

options.label: Rare Combo
options.description: Unusual mix of skills/backgrounds

options.label: Domain Expert
options.description: Deep knowledge in specific area

options.label: Strong Network
options.description: Know key people in the field

options.label: Speed
options.description: Learn and execute faster than others

options.label: Culture Bridge
options.description: Connect different communities/perspectives

options.label: Problem Spotter
options.description: See opportunities others miss

fields.label: Deep motivation?
fields.context: Beyond the obvious reasons, what really drives you? Understanding this helps during tough times when surface motivations aren't enough.
fields.placeholder: Example: I grew up seeing my parents struggle financially despite working hard. I want to prove that with the right strategy and skills, you can break out of that cycle. I also love the feeling of building something from nothing - it's like creating magic.

fields.label: Starting projects
fields.context: How are you at beginning new initiatives? This affects which opportunities you should pursue first.

fields.label: Handling obstacles
fields.context: Every goal hits roadblocks. How do you typically respond when things get difficult or don't go as planned?

fields.label: Risk tolerance?
fields.context: Your comfort with uncertainty affects which paths and timelines make sense for you. There's no wrong answer here.

options.label: Risk Avoider
options.description: Prefer guaranteed outcomes, detailed plans

options.label: Calculated
options.description: Analyze risks, take smart bets

options.label: Comfortable
options.description: See uncertainty as normal part of growth

options.label: Risk Seeker
options.description: Energized by uncertainty and big swings

title: üåç Reality Check
subtitle: Let's get real about your situation
context: This is where dreams meet reality. Being honest here prevents you from setting plans that are doomed to fail. We'll work with your real constraints, not fantasy ones.

fields.label: Time reality?
fields.context: Look at your actual calendar for the past week. When could you realistically work on this? Be specific about days, times, and how long you can sustain it.
fields.placeholder: Example: Realistically, I have Tuesday/Thursday evenings 8-10pm after kids are in bed, and Saturday mornings 7-9am before family wakes up. I could maybe squeeze in 30 minutes during lunch breaks 2-3 times per week, but that's not guaranteed with my current workload.

fields.label: Financial constraints?
fields.context: This affects which resources (courses, tools, events) you can access and how quickly you need to see returns on your investment.

options.label: Tight
options.description: Every dollar counts, need free/low-cost options

options.label: Limited
options.description: Can invest $50-200/month in growth

options.label: Moderate
options.description: Can invest $200-500/month comfortably

options.label: Flexible
options.description: Money isn't the limiting factor

fields.label: Support system? (Select all that apply)
fields.context: Who can help you stay accountable, provide advice, or just understand why this matters to you? Support systems dramatically increase success rates.

options.label: Family
options.description: Spouse/family understand and support your goals

options.label: Friends
options.description: Friends who encourage your ambitions

options.label: Mentors
options.description: People ahead of you willing to guide

options.label: Peers
options.description: Others pursuing similar goals

options.label: Professional
options.description: Coaches, advisors, paid support

options.label: Going Solo
options.description: Prefer to figure it out independently

fields.label: Self-doubt?
fields.context: Everyone has these thoughts. Naming them reduces their power and helps us address them directly. What's the voice in your head saying?
fields.placeholder: Example: I worry I'm too old to switch careers. What if I spend all this time and effort and still can't compete with people who have traditional backgrounds? My family thinks I'm crazy for wanting to leave a stable job. Maybe I'm just having a quarter-life crisis and should stick with what I know.

fields.label: Gut feeling?
fields.context: Forget logic for a moment. When you imagine yourself achieving this goal, what does your intuition tell you? Trust that inner voice.
fields.description: How confident are you that this will work out?

title: üî¢ Belief Level
subtitle: How much do you believe this is possible?
context: Your belief level is one of the strongest predictors of success. If it's low, that's valuable data - we need to build evidence and confidence before attempting big moves.

fields.label: On a scale of 1-7, how strong is your belief that you can achieve this?
fields.context: 1 = This feels impossible, 7 = I'm absolutely certain I can make this happen. Be honest - we can work on building belief if it's currently low.

fields.label: What would help you believe even more?
fields.context: What evidence, support, or experiences would increase your confidence? This helps us design early wins and build momentum.
fields.placeholder: Example: If I could find one person who made a similar transition and hear their story. If I could complete one small project successfully to prove I can do this. If I had a mentor who believes in me. If I could see a clear, step-by-step plan that others have followed.
